data.title: XmlImporter was failing on all array types.
data.body: Note that the same sort of fix is required for lists, or really any generic type, to deserialize properly.

data.title: Cleaning up bin/obj paths for Tool projects.
data.body:
Renamed/moved Pipeline solution to Tools/Tools (Windows).sln
It is now the one and only solution for all (windows) tool projects.

All projects within the tools folder use the following to define their output and intermediate directories:
..\bin<platform>\$(Configuration)\
..\obj<platform>\$(Configuration)\
Where <platform> is one of the following: Windows\MacOS\Linux

The net result of this change is that everything isn't in the root of Tools/bin anymore, and other important files that need to be in the executable folder (like pdb's for debug builds, and the Templates folder) don't have to be copied as a post build step.

data.title: Cache ContentReader/ContentTypeReader
data.body:
This discovery was made by @RayBatts.  He was able to more than half the loading times on a game we're porting by caching the reflection work that `ReflectiveReader<T>` does.

Currently for every `ContentManager.Load<>()` the runtime does the following:
- Allocates a new `ContentReader`.
- Allocates a new `ContentTypeReader` for each type encountered.
- The `ReflectiveReader<T>` will use reflection on every property/field read from disk.
- When done loading we destroy all this stuff and start over.

This is VERY bad for games on mobile with limited CPUs, games that have 1000s of content files, or games with content files that have 100s of properties repetitively read via `ReflectiveReader<T>`.  The current implementation does a ton more work than it has to and generates a bunch of garbage in the process.

 What needs to happen is the following:
- We should try to reuse `ContentReader` if at all possible.
- We need to cache all the `ContentTypeReader`s and reuse them across content files (reusing `ContentReader` will do this automatically).
- `ReflectiveReader<T>` needs to precache the getters for properties/fields that it can read during initialization.

All this together should give us a 2x or more performance improvement in reflection heavy content files and/or games with lots of content.

We will use the work @RayBatts did as a starting point and get a PR up soon that cleans up this mess.

data.title: Mouse scroll is inverted on Linux
data.body:
The value from Mouse.GetState().ScrollWheelValue is inverted (that is, multiplied by -1) on Linux. A quick debug led me to Input/Mouse.cs, which revealed that the source of the problem is OpenTK: OpenTK.Input.Mouse.GetCursorState().Scroll.Y is already multiplied by -1.

I've tried to update to the latest version of OpenTK (from the github repository), and it went back to normal. However, I only tested it on Linux; also, the upgrade required me to make some changes in the MonoGame framework (for instance, OpenTK.Input.MouseState.Scroll.Y doesn't exist anymore, so I used OpenTK.Input.MouseState.Wheel).

data.title: Effect parameter float3x2
data.body: Add missing support for float3x2 matrices in EffectParameter.SetValue. This issue was exposed trying to fix #2054 (it is not solving that issue though)

data.title: Effect parameter float3x2
data.body: Adding missing case for float3x2 matrices (there are more cases missing i believe). This issue was exposed when trying to fix #2054

data.title: Xact Improvements
data.body:
This PR has a few improvements to the core Xact system as well as some reorganization.
- Xact now reuses the SoundEffect pool.
- Initial support for Xact variation playlists.
- Moved Xact into its own subfolder in Audio.
- Moved out clip events into their own source files.

This is all preliminary work for https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2661.

data.title: PipelineTool command line argument 'project to open'
data.body: Also fixed crash when looking for templates in the project directory, assuming the directory existed.

data.title: Adding 'Open File' and 'Open File Location' to PipelineTool tree context menu.
data.body:
Adding 'Open File' and 'Open File Location' to PipelineTool tree context menu.

Added IProjectItem.OriginalPath.
- For PipelineProject this replaces FullPath
- For ContentItem this replaces SourceFile
- For FolderItem this is identical to Location

Added IController.GetFullPath(string) which returns the an absolute path given a project relative path (or returns unchanged path if already rooted).

data.title: Non-static GraphicsCapabilities [2]
data.body:
Every GraphicsDevice now have it's own GraphicsCapabilities because an application (tools/viewer/editors/etc)might have more that one Device, possibly with different GraphicsProfile/FeatureLevel.

We need to check for capabilities only before performing actions on a devices, so a GraphicsDevice instance -and its GraphicsCapabilities- will always be accessible when needed. So, I don't see change cause any real issues in the future.

I have only tested this under WP8/Win8 in a real production project.

data.title: Non-static GraphicsCapabilities
data.body:
Every GraphicsDevice now have it's own GraphicsCapabilities because an application (tools/viewer/editors/etc)might have more that one Device, possibly with different GraphicsProfile/FeatureLevel.

We need to check for capabilities only before performing actions on a devices, so a GraphicsDevice instance -and its GraphicsCapabilities- will always be accessible when needed. So, this change wont cause any problems in the future.

data.title: PipelineTool undo/redo
data.body:
Implemented undo/redo for the following actions:
Adding a ContentItem
Removing a ContentItem
Creating a ContentItem
Editing a ContentItem property.

Still missing:
Editing a PipelineProject property.

data.title: Add Android SoundEffect classes and Dispose pattern
data.body:
Separated Android SoundPool implementation into its own partial classes.
Implemented proper Dispose pattern on SoundEffect, SoundEffectInstance and OALBuffer.
OpenAL throws NoAudioHardwareException if OpenAL drivers could not be loaded.

data.title: Pipeline GUI Tool Undo/Redo
data.body:
Implemented undo/redo for Add Item, Remove Item, and New Item.

Undo/redo for changes on items done through the propertygrid is not yet implemented.

data.title: New Content
data.body: Can now create new content items to be added to the project from within Pipeline Tool. The definitions which define a type of content which can be created are called templates. These are defined by data files. Currently only Font and XmlContent templates exist.

data.title: Pipeline Tool Improvements
data.body:
More improvements to the Pipeline GUI tool:
- You can now toggle "Debug Mode" in the build menu and it will prompt the launch of the VS debugger for debugging the content building process.
- Fixed error where the build/rebuild items were popup menus.
- Deletion of items no longer leaves folders without children.
- The context menu for the tree view is now common for folders and items.
- Rebuild in the tree context menu now works when you multiselect items.
- Fixed the "Add Items..." context menu handler.

data.title: ReflectiveWriter Fix
data.body:
This fixes the `ReflectiveWriter` to be a template type resolving incorrect type writer index values caused by collisions between different `ReflectiveWriter` types.

This also has a fix to `EnumWriter<>` creation which would previously crash.

data.title: Added MonoGame.Content.Builder.targets to automatically build and redirect the output of referenced Content Projects
data.body:
MonoGame.Content.Builder.targets automatically builds all referenced MonoGame Content Projects ( they need to import a new MonoGame.Content.Pipeline.targets from MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline folder ).

Adding reference to a Content Project is done by creating a new < MonoGameContentReference > item inside the < ItemGroup > tag, for example:

```
<ItemGroup>
  <MonoGameContentReference Include="..\Content1\Content1.contentproj" />
</ItemGroup>
```

Compiled .xnb files are automatically moved to a game directory. For most platforms it is:

```
bin\$(ContentRootDirectory)
```

For Android:

```
obj\assets\$(ContentRootDirectory)
```

But you can always tweak this.

data.title: DictionaryReader unnecessarily made internal
data.body:
In order for us to make custom type readers that register with ContentTypeReaderManager (a public class), the actual core content type reader classes need to be public. Someone has made DictionaryReader internal which is unnecessary.

Please do not constrain the scope of classes without considering how they are being used to extend the framework.

data.title: PipelineTool treeview multiselection support.
data.body:
Delete action will affect all selected items, including child items of selected folders.
Rebuild option within context menu builds all selected items, including child items of selected folders.

data.title: Added preprocess step for response files.
data.body:
Supported preprocessor macros:
$set Name=Value
$if Name=Value
$endif

data.title: No garbage generation in SensorBase.
data.body: For each accelerometer event new `SensorReadingEventArgs` object was created.

data.title: MGFX Sampler issues
data.body:
Looks like the OpenGL side of the MGFX is broken, DualTextureEffect no longer compiles. It looks like it has problems resolving the second texture symbols at this point

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/Tools/2MGFX/ShaderData.mojo.cs#L121
because the second value in 'samplers' has garbage in it.. 

Possibly a side effect of moving to x64?

data.title: Windows GL Tests Crash
data.body:
Running through the Windows GL tests and I get a NullReferenceException on line 304 of OpenTKGamePlatform.cs. I think some memory corruption has occurred at this point in the testing and the NRE is happening inside of the Dispose.

The exception stack trace:

at OpenTK.Toolkit.Dispose(Boolean manual) in c:\temp\opentk\Source\OpenTK\Toolkit.cs:line 174
   at OpenTK.Toolkit.Dispose() in c:\temp\opentk\Source\OpenTK\Toolkit.cs:line 162
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.OpenTKGamePlatform.Dispose(Boolean disposing) in c:\github\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\Desktop\OpenTKGamePlatform.cs:line 304
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.Finalize() in c:\github\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\GamePlatform.cs:line 123

data.title: Fixed RuntimeType For ListReader/DictionaryWriter
data.body:
This fix allows the `ListWriter` and `DictionaryWriter` to correctly write the overloaded runtime types defined via the `ContentSerializerRuntimeTypeAttribute`.

Fixes https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2649.

data.title: iOS doesn't change orientation when game is upside down
data.body:
Hi,

I am running MonoGame from source and my iOS projects do not support changing of the screen orientation. The game always starts upside down too. This happens on both iPhone and iPad. EDIT: I do not have screen orientation updates on Windows or Windows Phone either. 

Thanks,
Christian

data.title: Implement XactImporter and XactProcessor
data.body:
We need to implement a real XactImporter and XactProcessor under the new MonoGame pipeline.

In Microsoft XNA these don't actually exist... under the hold these are piped to the command line XACT tools.

For MonoGame these should be a real importer/processor combo.  They should really parse XAP (XACT Audio Project) files and generate binaries for the platform.  This gives us the ability to replace the compressed audio with one optimized to the targeted platform.

The XAP format is easily readable in any text editor and should be easy to parse into a simple set of XapContent classes inside of the XactImporter.

The XactProcessor would convert the wave and sound data in the XapContent from uncompressed PCM to compressed format.

The XactWriter would write out the various binary files using our existing runtime Xact loading code as a guide to the format.

data.title: Fixed shifted drawing on KitKat after app resume.
data.body:
Fixed issues:
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2492
http://community.monogame.net/t/bug-after-samsung-update-detecting-viewport-height-as-width/593
Reproduced and tested on Android emulator.
